oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-04-23 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from April 23, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Jim Reeves (host/performer), guest performer Margie Bowes, and regular performers the Old Hickory Singers, Tommy Jackson, Archie Campbell, and Del Wood. On this show, Chet Atkins presents Jim Reeves with a gold record for 1 million sales of 'He'll Have To Go'. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1072nd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jim Reeves; Old Hickory Singers; Margie Bowes; Tommy Jackson; Archie Campbell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Jim Reeves -- Billy Bayou (Jim Reeves) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Jim Reeves) -- Jim Reeves introduces the Old Hickory Singers -- The Little Green Valley / Old Folks At Home (medley) (Old Hickory Singers) -- Grant Turner and Jim Reeves introduce Margie Bowes -- One Broken Heart (Margie Bowes) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Jim Reeves) -- Jim Reeves introduces Tommy Jackson -- Grey Eagle (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Grant Turner and Jim Reeves talk -- The Flowers, The Sunset, The Trees (Jim Reeves) -- Grant Turner introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Jim Reeves)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jackson, Tommy; Campbell, Archie; Old Hickory Singers; Reeves, Jim; Bowes, Margie; Young, Faron
